frontmatter.title: Vehicle Recognition and Compilation in Database
frontmatter.excerpt: I built this project during the Smart India Hackathon 2020. It contains 7 Neural Networks which gives 12 different predictions at each step. It involves extracting License Plate Numbers along with vehicle Make, Model, Color, Damage, Date-time-location stamps of suspect vehicles using video footage from CCTV cameras. Even if the license plate is not clearly visible, we still have other attributes to track the suspect vehicle.

frontmatter.title: Realtime Attention Span Tracking in Online Education
frontmatter.excerpt: I developed a system to monitor the attention span of students using the webcam and send alerts in real-time. It uses 6 parameters - Blink rate, Eye gaze, Emotion, Body posture and Background noise to track the attention level of students. Facial recognition is used for automated attendance and to avoid proxies. It can also be used to prevent cheating during exams and to evaluate the teaching standards.

frontmatter.title: Self-Driving Car Simulation using Convolutional Neural Networks
frontmatter.excerpt: This mini-project was inspired by Elon Musk's Tesla - autonomous cars. I simulated the working of a self-driving car using AlexNet in the game Grand Theft Auto V. GTA V has a diverse environment including real-time traffic and pesastrians. It involves advanced lane detection, vehicle and obstacle detection and collision avoidance. I manually collected over 20 hours of gameplay video for training the CNN and achieved 90% accuracy.

frontmatter.title: Protocol 22e Website
frontmatter.excerpt: I developed this website for our department symposium Protocol 22e. The website was built using HTML, CSS and Javascript. I used particles.js to create the amazing background effect to improve the interactivity of the webpage. Over 400 students from various colleges participated in 10 different technical and non-technical events. It was a huge success and I am proud to be a part of the organizing committee. Check the website out https://protocol22e.netlify.app

frontmatter.title: Lab Report Digitization
frontmatter.excerpt: This project was developed during a 24 hour hackathon in which we were provided with lab report images and PDF files containing text within tables and our task was to extract the text without losing the format. We used Optical Character Recognition and Template matching using image processing algorithms to produce the output of the reports in the form of excel files. This will be very useful in reducing manual labour and to digitize reports automatically.

frontmatter.title: American Sign Language Recognition
frontmatter.excerpt: American Sign Language (ASL) is a natural language that consists of 26 alphabets and 10 digits, each with a different hand gesture. I collected a dataset consisting of 300 images for each sign and trained a Convolutional Neural Network to detect hands and recognize the hand gesture with an accuracy of 91%. This will help the deaf and hard-of-hearing better communicate using image processing and deep learning technologies.

frontmatter.title: Handwriting text recognition
frontmatter.excerpt: Different people have different handwritings and it is a challenge for computer to detect and understand text from input sources such as paper documents and photographs. I tried to build a Neural Network to recognize hand-written text in english language. I collected dataset containing millions of annotated hand-written alphabets and digits from various sources and used it to train the model. The detected text is saved in a text document.

frontmatter.title: Assistive tool for visually challenged people
frontmatter.excerpt: This was my first project in MATLAB software. The project involves detecting, recognizing and segmenting over 80 classes of objects such as person, car, tree, etc. I used a pre-trained Neural Network and modified it to work with webcamera. And everytime an object is detected, the software will read out the name of the object using Text-to-Speech engine. It will be useful for visually challenged people to feel the world around them.

frontmatter.title: License Plate Recognition
frontmatter.excerpt: License Plate Recognition is the first paper I presented during the NCCI 2018 conference and secured 2nd place. It involves image processing to detect the plate region, character segmentation and OCR to recognize the plate number. I collected plate images to train a CNN to identify plates. The plate region is scanned for text using Tesseract OCR and the text is extracted. I used template matching to check whether the plate complies to the standards defined by the government.
